#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=Would you agree that part of Iran 's vested interest in Syria remaining under al-Assad is bound to two factors : religion and strategy ?
#Text=Former President of Iran Mahmoud Ahmedinejad who stepped down earlier this year .
#Text=Image : Russian Presidential Press and Information Office .
#Text=Kamrava : No , I do not agree .
#Text=Iran 's " vested interest in Syria remaining under al-Assad " is [ a ] product only of Iran 's strategic calculations .

column1: #Text=While foreign policies anywhere may be expressed — and justified — through slogans and ideological rhetoric , they are based on strategic considerations and calculations .
#Text=Despite common , journalistic misconceptions , religion has not played a role in Iranian foreign policy ; whether in relation to Syria or anywhere else .
#Text=Martel : Iran 's vested interest in Syria is entirely geo-strategic .
#Text=Iran 's support [ for ]
#Text=Syria is designed to undermine US power and influence .
#Text=For Iran , no policy objective is more important than to possess nuclear weapons .
#Text=When the U.S. declared a " redline " if Syria " used or moved " chemical weapons , and then backed away from that redline , it is likely that Iran 's leadership drew one principal conclusion :
#Text=the US redline on Iran 's nuclear program is in doubt , the US commitment to preventing Iran from possessing nuclear weapons is in doubt ,
#Text=and that Iran likely will test US resolve .
#Text=In strategic terms , doubts about the credibility of the US redline on Iran dwarfs any concerns about Syria 's chemical weapons .
#Text=The belief in Iran — that the US may not be willing to prevent Iran from possessing nuclear weapons — could lead to a nuclear arms race in the Middle East .
#Text=It is difficult to exaggerate just how dangerous a nuclear-armed Iran is for regional and global security .
#Text=Posch : No , it is strategy , and perhaps ideology .
#Text=Religion does n't play too much [ of ] a role , even though the conflict has been thoroughly " sectarianised " .
#Text=This happened a few years back when the Saudis baptised ( if that term is appropriate ) the " axis of resistance " to " shiite crescent " .

column1: #Text=The domination of the Syrian Baath Party by members of one sect plays no role in Iran 's security equation .
#Text=Attempts to convert Syrian Alevites to Mainstream Shiites are initiatives of some individual Ayatollahs .
#Text=I have already mentioned the strategic aspect , [ an ] axis of resistance against Israel and Saudi Arabia simultaneously ; to this I would add Iranian concern over the Kurdish issue .
#Text=Farhi : The Assad government is a secular government , and Iran 's relationship with it has nothing to do with religion or religious affinities .

#Text=The relationship is a complex one — and , as mentioned before — forged as a strategic bond during the Iran – Iraq War , when Saddam 's regime was deemed aggressively expansionist by both regimes .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) Iran is home to the world 's most populous Shiite Muslim nation .
#Text=The Syrian rebels are Sunni .
#Text=Could this be a Sunni vs. Shiite alignment in the Middle East ?
